headline: Could Higher Preferred Yields Reinforce KeyCorp’s (KEY) Stability or Signal Caution on Deposit Flows?
summary: KeyCorp recently highlighted that its Series I preferred shares now offer an 8.2% floating yield, following five consecutive quarters of higher net interest income due to increased asset yields and disciplined interest expense management. An interesting aspect is that manageable deposit outflows and a conservative loan-to-deposit ratio have supported the bank's stable financial footing, while resuming loan growth and attractive preferred share yields may enhance appeal to income-focused...
